item.title: Deep Blue
item.dc:creator: user
item.description: Deep Blue is honestly the easiest challenge. It deals with knowing your Windows Event codes and looking at the CMD. In this room I learned how to identify Meterpreter which allows an attacker to control a victim’s computer by running an invisible shell and establishing a communication channel back to the attacking machine, using event […]
item.content:encoded: Deep Blue is honestly the easiest challenge. It deals with knowing your Windows Event codes and looking at the CMD. In this room I learned how to identify Meterpreter which allows an attacker to control a victim’s computer by running an invisible shell and establishing a communication channel back to the attacking machine, using event viewer. It’s all about taking your time, thinking, and asking yourself “Should a software update be in a user’s downloads file path?” This is only the beginning of showing what I’m capable of doing. For more information on DeepBlueCLI check out https://github.com/sans-blue-team/DeepBlueCLI.
